lexUnit.name: blond.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of hair) fair or pale yellow. Having fair hair and a pale complexion. Usually pertaining to males.

sentence.text: He had his back to me , and he had grown a beard , but his hair was still thick and blond .
His hair was blond streaked , stylishly short at the back but with swinging forelocks .
` You OK ? " asked Ember , and his hair was a dark untidy blond whipping from under his pointed hood .
The hair is blond , curly , almost tangled .
His hair was peroxide blond and his eyebrows and lashes naught but snowy bristles .
He brushed his blond hair back from his cheek with a swift gesture , leaving the hand poised on his shoulder as if touching some invisible insignia .
He had pinkish freckles and spiky blond eyelashes , and eyes red-rimmed with too much chlorine .
He meant the blond guy .
Are you ? " she called , and he swung round , his hand hovering over his oiled , blond hair .
He has recently grown a blond beard .
She had wavy blond hair and was rather attractive apart from the beginnings of a moustache .
At that moment she hated the bald guide with her one lock of blond hair curled in the hollow of her nape .
FitzAlan did n't look any drier , she thought critically , his blond hair darkened with rain , his tunic drenched , and his boots squelching with every step .
` When I see the old truck you drive , I 'll give it a slap , " the little blond boy on my right said to his father , slapping him heartily in demonstration .
David Shelley was so taken with her beautiful blond hair and the pink ensemble he accompanied her back to her room and cot , asking Ada no end of awkward questions .
But it was as a young cricketer , distinctive even then with his fair complexion and blond hair ( hence ` Ghost " , years later ) , that he particularly impressed his games master , John Kitson .
The spectre carried a great staff and , with his high forehead and blond hair , bore an uncanny resemblance to a painting of St John .
Out came the remainder of the hambone , the cheese , the loaf , an unopened bottle of wine , then the blond man paused with his hand in the sack as though he were holding something .
The blond man looked faintly amused .
Robyn turned and saw a tall blond man with a smiling mouth strolling casually towards her .
Photographs of his wife and two pretty blond children were displayed in silver frames on his desk .

Quite apart from the Pre-Raphaelite blond ringlets and blue eyes which immediately , and utterly , transfixed Branson , Joan Templeman had an air of self-contained , utterly unflappable Glaswegian common sense .
BLOND MALE , 16 , wants exciting , beautiful , intelligent penfriends !
Her brows and lashes were blond ; he observed so much .
His wife was blond .
It 's blond and it looks brilliant .
Why is it that strangers believe , if you 're blond and twenty-three and wear a black chiffon nightgown , that you are a nitwit ?
